marketNews.title: BI Holds Interest Rate, In Line with Expectations
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia decided to hold the BI Rate at the level of 5.75% today, Wednesday (19/2), with the deposit facility and lending facility also maintained at 5% and 6.5% respectively. This decision is in line with consensus expectations. Bank Indonesia Governor, Perry Warjiyo, stated that this decision is an effort to stabilize the rupiah exchange rate, keep inflation under control, and encourage economic growth. Perry mentioned that they see room for further reduction in the BI Rate, mainly due to low inflation and to support economic growth. Nevertheless, Perry explained that the timing of the next BI Rate cut will depend on global dynamics. Meanwhile, the Bloomberg consensus expects the BI Rate to still decrease by another 50 bps to the level of 5.25% by the end of 2025. Bank Indonesia still maintains its expectation of a 25 bps interest rate cut by the Fed during 2025, the same as the expectation last month and in line with consensus expectations based on the CME FedWatch Tool analysis as of Wednesday (19/2). Perry emphasized efforts to maintain the stability of the rupiah exchange rate through the optimization of pro-market monetary instruments, such as SRBI, SVBI, and SUVBI. In addition, the revision of the implementation rules for export proceeds from natural resources effective March 1, 2025, is expected to support the stability of the rupiah exchange rate going forward. Bank Indonesia also increased the macroprudential liquidity incentive (KLM) from a previous maximum of 4% of DPK to a maximum of 5% of DPK. Furthermore, the amount of KLM incentives for the housing sector - including public housing - will be gradually increased starting April 1, 2025, from 23 trillion rupiahs to around 80 trillion rupiahs to support government housing programs. On Wednesday (19/2), the IHSG fell by -1.14%, with the rupiah exchange rate against the US dollar weakening by -0.42% to the level of 16,339, and the 10-year government bond yield rising by +14 bps to the level of 6.901%. Key Takeaway: This decision was met negatively by the market, with the IHSG posting a net foreign outflow in the regular market of 964 billion rupiah today, stopping the foreign inflow trend of the previous 2 days. Sectors sensitive to interest rates - such as banking/finance (-1.78%) and property (-0.80%) - experienced declines today. On the other hand, the increase in KLM incentives can be good news for the banking sector, considering that liquidity conditions tend to be tight.

marketNews.title: Coal Prices Plunge Near 4-Year Low, APBI Says It Has Side Effects
marketNews.content: The Acting Executive Director of the Indonesian Coal Mining Association (APBI), Gita Mahyarani, stated on Tuesday (18/2) that the decline in coal prices in recent months will cause a balance in domestic coal production, given that the cost to produce coal is currently quite high. Gita's statement came after the coal price touched the level of 102 US dollars per ton on Tuesday (18/2), approaching the lowest level in the last 4 years. Furthermore, a prolonged decline in coal prices will be felt first by miners located in regions with high logistics tariffs, such as Central Kalimantan and Jambi. Gita also explained that the decline in coal prices is closely related to the increase in production this year targeted by the world's 2 largest importers, China and India.

marketNews.title: President Prabowo Conducts First Cabinet Reshuffle, Appointing New Minister of Higher Education, Science, and Technology
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto on Wednesday (19/2) appointed Brian Yuliarto as the new Minister of Higher Education, Science, and Technology, replacing Satryo Brodjonegoro. This move marks President Prabowo's first cabinet reshuffle since taking office in October 2024, and may provide an indication of how he handles controversies among his ministers. The reshuffle follows demonstrations by employees at the ministry in January 2025 regarding Satryo Brodjonegoro's leadership style. Brian Yuliarto currently serves as the Vice Rector for Research and Innovation at the Bandung Institute of Technology.

marketNews.title: Finance Ministry Projects 2025 APBN Deficit Remains at 2.53% Despite Budget Efficiency Claims
marketNews.content: Deputy Minister of Finance, Suahasil Nazara, stated on Tuesday (18/2) that the total budget funds freed up by the government through efficiency remain unchanged at 306.7 trillion rupiah. Suahasil's statement came after President Prabowo Subianto claimed last weekend that budget savings in the first year of his tenure reached 750 trillion rupiah, consisting of savings from the state treasury budget section, ministry/agency efficiency, and State-Owned Enterprise dividend revenues. Suahasil declined to comment further on the higher savings figure mentioned by President Prabowo, while the presidential spokesperson has not yet commented on the issue. Despite the savings, the Ministry of Finance on Tuesday (18/2) projected the 2025 APBN deficit to remain at the level of 2.53%.

marketNews.title: Free Lunch Program Budget Increased to IDR 171 Trillion, Claimed to Boost GDP by +2 Percentage Points
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto's advisor and brother, Hashim Djojohadikusumo, stated on Wednesday (19/2) that the government has increased the budget for the free lunch program in 2025 from 71 trillion rupiah to 171 trillion rupiah. Hashim claimed that according to the National Development Planning Agency, the contribution of this program with the latest budget to Indonesia's economic growth will reach +2 percentage points, higher than the initial budget's contribution of only +0.83 percentage point. Hashim also claimed that the free lunch program with the new budget will reach 82 million people, higher than the initial budget estimate of around 17.5 million people. Previously, the Ministry of Finance stated that the free lunch program with a budget of 171 trillion rupiah would reach approximately 40 million people in 2025, while the Head of the National Nutrition Agency, Dadan Hindayana, claimed that this budget would reach almost 83 million people in 2025.

marketNews.title: Banking Credit Growth Slows to +10.27% YoY in 1M25, Below BI Target Range
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia recorded that banking credit growth slowed to the level of +10.27% YoY in 1M25 (vs. 2024: +10.39% YoY), marking the lowest growth since November 2023 and below Bank Indonesia's target range of +11-13%. Based on utilization, investment credit grew by +13.22% YoY, consumption credit by +10.37% YoY, and working capital by +8.4% YoY. Meanwhile, Sharia financing in 1M25 grew by +9.71% YoY, and MSME credit growth reached +2.88% YoY. Going forward, Bank Indonesia will continue to encourage credit growth through various accommodative macroprudential policies so that it can support economic growth.

tickerNews.title: TPIA Subsidiary Reportedly Going Public Before Mid-2025; TPIA Has Not Commented
tickerNews.content: Katadata reported that Chandra Asri Pacific will bring its subsidiary in the infrastructure sector, PT Chandra Daya Investasi, to IPO on the IDX before mid-2025. TPIA has not responded to this issue. Previously, TPIA itself mentioned in an information disclosure in August 2024 that the company began exploring the possibility of an IPO plan for PT Chandra Daya Investasi, but the plan is still in the internal discussion stage.

tickerNews.title: ARNA Records IDR 110 Billion Net Profit in 4Q24, Meeting Stockbit Estimate
tickerNews.content: Arwana Citramulia recorded a net profit of 110 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (-2% QoQ, +19% YoY). This result brought the net profit for 2024 to 424 billion rupiah (-4% YoY), in line with expectations as it equaled 100.5% of the Stockbit estimate. This result is also consistent with our turnaround thesis in Unboxing ARNA, where the company recorded revenue growth of +17% YoY in 4Q24, marking a consistent revenue recovery in the last few quarters (vs. 2Q24: +4% YoY, 3Q24: +14% YoY). This revenue recovery was supported by sales volume growth of +11.7% YoY in 4Q24, resulting in a YoY sales volume increase of +7.4% for 2024. Although the gross profit margin in 4Q24 slightly decreased to 34.3% (-20 bps QoQ, -60 bps YoY), the recovery in revenue growth managed to increase the EBIT margin to 20.1% (+0 bps QoQ, +30 bps YoY).

tickerNews.title: ISAT Director Vikram Sinha Acquires ~1.2 Million Shares, Raising Stake to 0.0129%
tickerNews.content: Indosat Director, Vikram Sinha, purchased approximately 1.2 million ISAT shares at an average price of 1,721 rupiah per share on February 13, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 2 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Vikram's ownership in ISAT increased from 0.0093% to 0.0129%.

tickerNews.title: AMMN Seeks Export Relaxation for Copper Concentrate as Smelter Commissioning Lags
tickerNews.content: Amman Mineral Internasional, through its subsidiary PT Amman Mineral Nusa Tenggara (AMNT), requested that the government provide an export relaxation for copper concentrate following smelter commissioning proceeding slower than planned. AMNT President Director, Rachmat Makkasau, stated that currently the copper smelter valued at 21 trillion rupiah has only reached about 48% of operating capacity since first starting the commissioning phase in June 2024 because the company is making various efforts to ensure no unwanted incidents occur, considering the smelter uses new technology very different from the company's mining capabilities. AMMN continues to make various efforts to accelerate smelter commissioning, including increasing the number of workers beyond the initial plan to ensure operational smoothness.

tickerNews.title: GOTO Coordinates with Manpower Ministry Regarding THR for Online Motorcycle Taxi Drivers
tickerNews.content: GoTo Gojek Tokopedia's Chief of Public Policy & Government Relations, Ade Mulya, stated that they are in intensive coordination with the Ministry of Manpower regarding holiday allowance (THR) for online motorcycle taxis (ojol). Ade explained that the company is committed to assisting according to its capacity and ability. Earlier this week, demonstrations by ojol drivers urged for THR payments equivalent to provincial minimum wage (UMP). Minister of Manpower, Yassierli, stated that the government will finalize THR regulations for ojol in the near future, although he did not specify the amount. Meanwhile, Deputy Minister of Manpower, Immanuel Ebenezer, has given an ultimatum to ride-hailing platform entrepreneurs to provide THR in cash and not as rice, sugar, or other basic necessities.

tickerNews.title: TLKM Signals Potential Share Buyback Following Stock Decline
tickerNews.content: Telkom Indonesia President Director, Ririek Adriansyah, signaled that the company will conduct a share buyback, although he did not provide further details. Ririek only said that the buyback plan will be announced in due course.

tickerNews.title: PGEO Signs Cooperation Agreement with Sinopec Star for Geothermal and Green Hydrogen Development
tickerNews.content: Pertamina Geothermal Energy signed a cooperation agreement with Sinopec Star Co. Ltd., a subsidiary of China Petrochemical Corporation, to develop geothermal energy and explore opportunities to develop green hydrogen in Indonesia, China, and other potential global markets.

tickerNews.title: WIKA Delays Bond/Sukuk Maturity Payment Due to Lack of New Contracts; Trading Halted
tickerNews.content: Wijaya Karya Corporate Secretary, Mahendra Vijaya, stated that as of February 14, 2025, the company had not recorded new contracts, causing the company to postpone the settlement of bonds and sukuk maturing on February 18, 2025. Mahendra mentioned that WIKA is currently facing challenging business conditions due to a decline in project tenders in 2024, from the government, State-Owned Enterprises, and private sectors. Mahendra also explained that WIKA will expand its market focus to dig for project potential from the government, SOEs, and private sector, as well as open opportunities for strategic cooperation with private and foreign parties, in order to increase the chances of winning future projects. Previously, the IDX temporarily halted the trading of WIKA shares as of Tuesday (18/2) along with the principal payment of sukuk and bonds maturing on February 18, 2025.

tickerNews.title: PRDA Plans IPO for Subsidiary Proline in 2-3 Years; New Facility to Triple Capacity in April 2025
tickerNews.content: Prodia Widyahusada's Chief Commissioner, Andi Wijaya, stated that the company plans to bring its business entity, PT Prodia Diagnostic Line (Proline), for an IPO within the next 2-3 years. PRDA currently holds a 39% stake in Proline, while PRDA's controller, PT Prodia Utama, is the main shareholder in the company. Proline was established in 2010 and has production lines for clinical reagents, urine strips, molecular products, immunology, rapid diagnostic test instruments, as well as in-vitro diagnostic (IVD) instruments and their spare parts. Andi mentioned that Proline already supplies products to 4,800 out of 10,416 community health centers (Puskesmas) in Indonesia and is currently building a new facility in Jababeka, Cikarang, targeted to be operational in April 2025. In the future, Proline's production capacity will increase up to 3 times, with hematology reagent production reaching 180,000 packs per year and clinical reagent production reaching 960,000 kits per year.

tickerNews.title: KLBF Shareholders Approve Cancellation of 61.7 Million Treasury Shares
tickerNews.content: Kalbe Farma ($KLBF) shareholders in the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPSLB) on Monday (17/2) approved the cancellation of 61.7 million treasury shares, equivalent to 0.13% of the total issued shares. Following this corporate action, the number of KLBF shares listed on the IDX became 46.8 billion shares.

tickerNews.title: MDIY Issues 127.1 Million Stock Option Rights for MESOP Stage 1
tickerNews.content: Daya Intiguna Yasa ($MDIY) announced that it has issued 127.1 million stock option rights for the MESOP stage 1 program on February 18, 2025. The exercise price is 1,650 rupiah per share, with the options valid until August 6, 2029.

tickerNews.title: CYBR Commissioner Patrick Rudolf Dannacher Purchases 3.2 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: ITSEC Asia ($CYBR) Commissioner, Patrick Rudolf Dannacher, purchased 3.2 million CYBR shares at an average price of 554 rupiah per share on February 17, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 1.8 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Patrick Rudolf Dannacher's ownership in CYBR increased from 0.296% to 0.321%.
